title: Eggs in Purgatory Recipe
description: Eggs in purgatory is a classic Italian recipe that poaches eggs in a rich and flavorsome garlic and tomato sauce for an amazing breakfast or brunch.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Eggs Eggs in Purgatory 4.8 (5) 4 Reviews 3 Photos Eggs in purgatory, also known as "uova in purgatorio", is a classic Italian breakfast dish of soft-cooked poached eggs in a delicious homemade tomato sauce flavored with garlic and capers. Easy to make in just 20 minutes! Serve with toast. Submitted by linacavezza Updated on April 9, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 3 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil 1 clove garlic, crushed 3 black Italian olives, pitted and chopped, or more to taste 1 teaspoon capers 1 anchovy fillet in oil, drained 7 ounces Italian tomato sauce (crushed tomatoes) ½ cup water 1 sprig chopped fresh parsley salt to taste 2 large eggs Directions Gather the ingredients. Morgan Hunt Glaze / Food Stylist: Emily Nabors Hall / Prop Stylist: Hannah Greenwood  Heat oil in a skillet over low heat. Add garlic, olives, capers, and anchovy; cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Morgan Hunt Glaze / Food Stylist: Emily Nabors Hall / Prop Stylist: Hannah Greenwood  Add tomato sauce and water, bring to a boil, and simmer until flavors combine, about 10 minutes. Add parsley and season with salt. Morgan Hunt Glaze / Food Stylist: Emily Nabors Hall / Prop Stylist: Hannah Greenwood  Gently add eggs directly into tomato sauce without breaking the yolks. Cook until eggs are just cooked, 3 to 5 minutes. Morgan Hunt Glaze / Food Stylist: Emily Nabors Hall / Prop Stylist: Hannah Greenwood  I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 245 Calories 20g Fat 10g Carbs 9g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 2 Calories 245 % Daily Value * Total Fat 20g 26% Saturated Fat 4g 19% Cholesterol 188mg 63% Sodium 470mg 20% Total Carbohydrate 10g 3% Dietary Fiber 3g 10% Total Sugars 1g Protein 9g 18% Vitamin C 28mg 31% Calcium 96mg 7% Iron 4mg 19% Potassium 454mg 10% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Eggs in Purgatory 01 of 03 Photo by  Morgan Hunt Glaze / Food Stylist: Emily Nabors Hall / Prop Stylist: Hannah Greenwood  02 of 03 Photo by  Chef Mo 06/06/2024 I made this twice. First was in a pot but the eggs disappeared. Definitely use a skillet. I cut back the olive oil to about half. I would make it again with 4 eggs. Toast is a must. I broiled at the end for the tops to cook just a touch. Very fancy and rich in flavor! 03 of 03 Photo by  AllrecipesPhoto 05/31/2018 1 You’ll Also Love Air Fryer Greek Frittata 1 Rating Margherita Mug Eggs 10 Ratings Potato and Vegetable Frittata 64 Ratings Sun-Dried Tomato and Goat Cheese Sous Vide Egg Bites 3 Ratings Shakshuka 410 Ratings Shakshooka 7 Ratings Chinese Tomato and Egg 8 Ratings Eggy Veggie Bake 33 Ratings Stir Fry Tomato and Eggs 23 Ratings Air Fryer Souffle Egg Cups 3 Ratings Quiche au Chou Romanesco (Romanesco and Mushroom Quiche) 3 Ratings Kuku Sabzi Menemen 14 Ratings Wrapped Mexican Eggs 26 Ratings Green Shakshuka 1 Rating Potato Crust Quiche 10 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
